results.title: Tullamarine Project [B/W]
results.brief_description: A crowd waves goodbye to a TAA flight at Essendon Airport, aerial shots of the City of Melbourne and Yarra River. Late developmental stages of construction on the Tullamarine Airport and Freeway. Shot in October 1968.
results.description: A crowd waves goodbye to a TAA flight at Essendon Airport, aerial shots of the City of Melbourne and Yarra River. Late developmental stages of construction on the Tullamarine Airport and Freeway. Shot in October 1968.

results.title: Tulips and spring bulbs
results.creator_credit: Bruce Franchini, Stuart Crowner and Perennial Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Gardens of the world”.
The vast, colourful bulb fields of our host audrey Hepburn’s native Holland are only a small part of a complex cultural phenomenon. Here bulbs are intertwined with the history and art of an entire country. The transformation from sleeping bulb to elegant bloom is miraculous. Narcissus, hyacinth, muscari and bluebells share the stage with the favourite, the tulip, for a grand tour of the spectacular Kreukenhof in Holland and Chenics Manor, in England and more. Hosted by Audrey Hepburn and narrated by Michael York.

results.title: Tulip
results.creator_credit: Rachel Griffiths, Louise Smith, Scott Bradley, Helen Campbell, Shaun Farrington and New South Wales Film and Television Office
results.brief_description: William (Bud Tingwell), has just lost his wife, Ruth, after forty-five years of marriage. In the days after her death he tries to adjust to life alone, but must first solve the dilemma of how to milk her cow, Tulip. Music by David Bridie.

results.title: Tuktu and the trials of strength
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
Strong and hardy Inuit hunters demonstrate and test their strength in boxing, tug-of-war, and other strenuous activities. We see and hear the drum dance, a demonstration of Inuit poetry and rhythm.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and ONF | NFB

results.title: Tuktu and the ten thousand fishes
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
Tuktu is taken on a fishing trip to the ancient stone weir. He sees his father and other hunters spear fish in great numbers, and watches his father and his uncle make fire with an Inuit fire drill.

results.title: Tuktu and the snow palace
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
After a trek to new hunting grounds, Tuktu’s family and friends build igloos, in particular a giant igloo where feasting, dancing and games take place. Suitable for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: Tuktu and the magic spear
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
Tuktu accompanies his family when fishing is done through the ice during the long cold winter. He also sees his father catch fish with a spear during the summer, Tuktu longs to grow up and spear fish too.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and ONF | NFB

results.title: Tuktu and the magic bow
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
The Inuit in far-off times used the bow and arrow for hunting. We see a bow being made and how the Inuit practise their shooting skill by aiming arrows at snow men and snow bears. Tuktu’s father proves himself the best at this test of hunting skill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and ONF | NFB
results.description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
The Inuit in far-off times used the bow and arrow for hunting. We see a bow being made and how the Inuit practise their shooting skill by aiming arrows at snow men and snow bears. Tuktu’s father proves himself the best at this test of hunting skill.

results.title: Tuktu and the indoor games
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
A happy, joyous look at the Inuit and the games they play in the big igloo. Outside, the wind and blizzard howl, but Tuktu’s family and friends ignore the weather. They juggle stones, skip and play with a delightful Inuit child. Finally Tuktu falls asleep and dreams about the good time he has had.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and ONF | NFB
